revised_title: Cryptic Hybridization in Daphnia: Intercontinental Mixing of Species
tldr: This study examines the genetic analysis of Daphnia galeata populations from North America and Europe, revealing four North American populations with genetic traits intermediate between the two regions. The findings suggest that European Daphnia galeata was introduced to North America and hybridized with native Daphnia, leading to non-random mating and the creation of new genetic variations.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Evolution
